revision.text: {|{{Infobox Aircraft Begin | name=BH-44 | image= | caption= }}{{Infobox Aircraft Type | type=[[Fighter aircraft]] | national origin=[[Czechoslovakia]] | manufacturer=[[ČKD-Praga]] | designer= | first flight=19 July 1932 | introduced= | retired= | status=Prototype only | primary user= | more users= | produced= | number built=2 | program cost= | unit cost= | developed from= | variants with their own articles= }} |} The '''Praga BH-44''' (designated '''E-44''' by the [[Czechoslovak Air Force]]) was a prototype [[Czechoslovakia|Czechoslovak]] [[Fighter aircraft|fighter]] [[biplane]] of the early 1930s. Only two were built, the rival [[Avia B-34]] being ordered instead. ==Design and development== In 1932, [[ČKD-Praga]], the aircraft department of the Czechoslovak company [[Praga (company)|Praga]], entered a competition to design a new fighter for the [[Czechoslovak Air Force]], with its design, the BH-44, competing against designs from [[Avia]] (the [[Avia B-34|B-34]]Green and Swanborough 1994, p. 36.) and [[Letov Kbely|Letov]] (the [[Letov Š-31|Š-231]]Green and Swanborough 1994, pp. 334–335.). The BH-44 was a single-[[interplane strut|bay]] [[biplane]] of mixed construction, with wooden wings and a fabric covered, steel-tube fuselage. Powerplant was a single [[Praga ESV]] water-cooled [[V12 engine]]. The first prototype made its maiden flight on 19 July 1932. Performance was unimpressive, as the engine delivered only {{convert|500|hp|kW|order=flip}} instead of the promised {{convert|750|hp|kW|order=flip}}. A second prototype (sometimes called the EH-144), fitted with a [[supercharger|supercharged]] Praga ESVK engine, flew in April 1934, but performance remained disappointing. The first prototype was therefore re-engined with a {{convert|650|hp|kW|order=flip}} [[Rolls-Royce Kestrel]] VII, flying in this form on 30 October 1934, and as such was evaluated by the Czechoslovak Air Force as the E-44. The imported Kestrel engine worked poorly with the fuel used by the Air Force, however, and the type was rejected, the B-34 being purchased instead. ==Specifications (ESV engine, performance estimated) == {{Aircraft specs |ref=The Complete Book of FightersGreen and Swanborough 1994, p. 483. |prime units?=met |genhide= |crew=1 |length m=7.62 |span m=9.25 |height m= |height ft= |height in= |height note= |wing area sqm=23.14 |wing area sqft= |wing area note= |aspect ratio= |airfoil= |empty weight kg=1462 |empty weight lb= |empty weight note= |gross weight kg=1837 |gross weight lb= |gross weight note= |max takeoff weight kg= |max takeoff weight lb= |max takeoff weight note= |fuel capacity= |more general= |eng1 number=1 |eng1 name=Praga ESV |eng1 type=water-cooled [[V12 engine]] |eng1 kw= |eng1 hp=750 |eng1 note=(predicted power - actual power {{convert|500|hp|kW|order=flip|abbr=on}}) |prop blade number= |prop name= |prop dia m= |prop dia ft= |prop dia in= |prop dia note= |perfhide= |max speed kmh=330 |max speed mph= |max speed kts= |max speed note= |range km= |range miles= |range nmi= |range note= |combat range km= |combat range miles= |combat range nmi= |combat range note= |ferry range km= |ferry range miles= |ferry range nmi= |ferry range note= |endurance=1.8 hours |ceiling m= |ceiling ft= |ceiling note= |g limits= |roll rate= |glide ratio= |climb rate ms= |climb rate ftmin= |climb rate note= |time to altitude=5.2 minutes to {{convert|3000|m|ft|abbr=on}} |sink rate ms= |sink rate ftmin= |sink rate note= |lift to drag= |wing loading kg/m2 |wing loading lb/sqft= |wing loading note= |disk loading kg/m2= |disk loading lb/sqft= |disk loading note= |power/mass= |thrust/weight= |more performance= |armament= |guns= |bombs= |rockets= |missiles= |hardpoints= |hardpoint capacity= |hardpoint rockets= |hardpoint missiles= |hardpoint bombs= |hardpoint other= |other armament= |avionics= }} ==See also== {{aircontent |see also=*[[Avia B-34]] *[[Letov Š-31]] |related= |similar aircraft= |lists= }} ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==References== {{refbegin}} *Green, William and Gordon Swanborough.
